div.p: The following example shows how the element can be used in a paragraph to mark up element names and computer code, including punctuation.
div.pre:
The code element represents a fragment of computer code.

When you call the activate() method on the robotSnowman object, the eyes glow.

The example below uses the begin keyword to indicate the start of a statement block. It is paired with an end keyword, which is followed by the . punctuation character (full stop) to indicate the end of the program.

div.p: The following example shows how a block of code could be marked up using the pre and code elements.
div.pre:
var i: Integer;
begin
   i := 1;
end.
div.p: A class is used in that example to indicate the language used.
